page.title: 12FAMILY LIFE - a Sunday
page.content: {Sunday 21st April 1985} Last Sunday everyone got up at 8.30am and had breakfast. Mum went to get the paper from the shop, then she went to church for the 9.30am service. Andrew and I played snooker, while Paul played cars, and Dad made some train mountains for our model railway. After lunch Dad made some bread, and Andrew and I played football outside, while Paul played with his Lego building bricks. At 5.00pm everyone had tea. For tea we had sandwiches, cakes and an orange drink. Then Andrew, Paul and I went outside to play. At 7.30pm we had supper, and read a book until 8.30pm, when we went to bed. Meanwhile, my parents wallpapered the lounge and watched television. { {By Peter Hurford. Age 8.}
